intro: Scabiosa praemorsa, commonly known as the death's-head hawkmoth flower, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe. It produces striking, spiny, pink or purple flower heads that resemble the head of a hawkmoth. The plant belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas. The flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
